value.name: Chris Arnold says jury service unfair and needs reform
value.description: Approximately two decades ago, I did my first stint of jury service – an experience both intriguing and somewhat chaotic. My reflection on the system leans toward scepticism and a firm belief that it is unjust to jurors and in dire need of reform.

value.name: DAN HODGES: Rishi has to call the bluff of rebels just like John Major did - or else suffer death by a thousand cuts
value.description: It will be a series of interventions, based around different trigger points. The polls are going to continue to get worse. 'Reform [formerly Ukip] will continue to gain ground. We've got by-elections coming up – they will be a disaster. And then we've ...

value.description: As progress on some measures in the Liberal-NDP confidence-and-supply agreement continue to play out publicly, the two parties have quietly been in talks to table electoral reform legislation before the next federal vote. Leading these negotiations on the ...

value.name: Politics latest: More names of plotters trying to oust Rishi Sunak expected to be revealed; Reform UK surges in polls
value.description: With Reform now level pegging with the Lib Dems in the Sky News poll tracker (see post at 7.54), their analysis is that the Tory party faces possible extinction if Nigel Farage joins the election campaign. So anything is worth a try. The Plot - led by a ...

value.name: Tory HQ probe into money behind Sunak coup amid Reform donor concerns
value.description: Conservatives will strip the whip from those working with mysterious group - including Lord Frost - if they have accepted funds from Reform donors

value.name: Rishi Sunak set to be rocked by 'seismic' by-election as Reform unleashes volunteer army

value.name: The plotters, the coup and Farage’s path to the Tory throne
value.description: Does Canada offer a blueprint for the predicted Conservative electoral wipeout – and a saviour to 'unite the Right' rising from the flames?

value.name: POLL: Do you think Nigel Farage could win a general election? Vote here
value.description: Nigel Farage has revealed his aim would be to win a general election if he makes a political comeback. Speculation is high over whether the former Ukip leader, who is currently honorary president of Reform UK, will return to frontline politics.

value.name: Council tax bands need overhauling, northern business group says
value.description: "If he was given free rein, I think we could have seen state council tax reform before the general election, but I'm not sure No 10 necessarily have the reforming zeal that perhaps Michael does." NPP has also called for additional council tax bands to be ...

value.name: A better, fairer social care system in England is affordable
value.description: ENDING the cycle of broken promises to reform social care funding in England must be a priority for the next government, a Health Foundation report says. Currently, Government only covers the costs of care for people with the highest needs and lowest means.

value.name: Juryless rape trial pilot in doubt as lawyers prepare to boycott

value.name: Analysis: Tax reform is the task no party wants to take on
value.description: At a time of high inflation, state pensions go up while the value of your wages go down. Nobody likes taxes, they’re unfair, but nobody wants to reform them. Earlier this week Rachel Reeves told The Yorkshire Post that she is not looking for a major ...
